intro: Talinum whitei, commonly known as white talinum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture. Talinum whitei is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
